column4: When I install Ubuntu if I already have an existing account and home folder on a previous ubuntu installation, can I make the new Ubuntu use that home/account without creating a new one?
Well, you can upgrade your Ubuntu install rather than doing a fresh install, that way its kept
Otherwise I think you'd have needed to create a separate /home partition when you first installed (don't think Ubuntu does this by default, some distributions do)
Not sure how that works with encryption though, if you keep your home partition whether it encrypts it
